LifestyleInterventionFramework.Purpose: Lifestyle recommendations for VCI prevention based on ReCOGnAIze research
LifestyleInterventionFramework.ResearchBasis: Mohammed et al., 2025 - Clinical trials including SPRINT MIND
LifestyleInterventionFramework.CorePrinciple: VCI responds to specific lifestyle interventions and intensive management of vascular risk factors
LifestyleInterventionFramework.EvidenceLevel: VCI may respond better to lifestyle interventions than AD-focused approaches
LifestyleInterventionFramework.PharmacotherapyNote: Current AD monoclonal antibodies less effective in VCI and carry increased cerebral hemorrhage risk

PhysicalActivity.Importance: Critical for managing vascular risk factors and maintaining cognitive function

VCIBenefits: Improves processing speed through enhanced blood flow

FocusAreas: Major muscle groups (legs, back, chest, arms)
VCIBenefits: Maintains muscle mass for vascular health

DASHDiet.PrimaryBenefit: Proven to reduce blood pressure and support vascular health

Vegetables.Focus: Leafy greens, broccoli, carrots, sweet potatoes

GrainProducts.Type: Whole grains (oats, brown rice, whole wheat bread)

Mediterranean-Style.Description: Evidence-based for cognitive health and vascular protection
KeyFeatures: Whole grains as primary carbohydrate source
Olive oil as main fat source
Mediterranean-Style.CognitiveProtection: Associated with slower cognitive decline and better processing speed

Antioxidants.VCIBenefit: Reduces oxidative stress in cerebrovascular disease

B-Vitamins.Relevance: Support homocysteine metabolism (elevated homocysteine linked to vascular disease)

CognitiveEngagement.Purpose: Build cognitive reserve and maintain neural plasticity

MentalStimulation: Puzzles and brain games (optimal if tablet-based like ReCOGnAIze)

DigitalCognitiveTesting.Recommendation: ReCOGnAIze app for regular cognitive assessment
DigitalCognitiveTesting.Frequency: Based on risk stratification (annually to every 3 years)
DigitalCognitiveTesting.Advantage: Detects VCI-specific cognitive changes missed by traditional tools

Sleep.VCIConnection: Poor sleep quality associated with increased white matter disease
Optimization: Maintain consistent bedtime and wake time
Sleep in cool, dark, quiet environment

StressManagement.Importance: Chronic stress increases blood pressure and vascular inflammation

SmokingCessation.CriticalImportance: Smoking major risk factor for cerebrovascular disease
SmokingCessation.ImmediateVCIBenefit: Brain blood flow improves within weeks of quitting
SmokingCessation.LongTermBenefit: White matter disease progression slowed significantly

AlcoholModeration.Definition: 1 drink = 5 oz wine, 12 oz beer, or 1.5 oz spirits

WeightManagement.VCIBenefit: Each 5-10% weight loss improves cardiovascular and cognitive outcomes

ImplementationStrategy.StartingPoint: Identify highest-impact interventions based on individual risk factors
ImplementationStrategy.Timeframe: Lifestyle changes require 8-12 weeks to show neurobiological impact
ImplementationStrategy.Monitoring: Reassess vascular risk factors every 3-6 months

CognitiveOutcomeExpectations.Timeline: Changes may require months to years for cognitive benefit
CognitiveOutcomeExpectations.OptimalOutcome: Slowing or halting cognitive decline progression
CognitiveOutcomeExpectations.DementiaPrevention: Intensive multi-factor intervention may delay dementia onset by 5+ years
CognitiveOutcomeExpectations.ConversionRisk: Without intervention, MCI individuals have 10-15% annual dementia conversion risk
